result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 11:07 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Adam Darrell Powers in court. DE states that he was told that he does not qualify for public defender, completed PFAC. Court reviews PFAC, approves petition and orders repayment in the amount of $50/month. Court notes previously scheduled hearings. Adjourned: 11:10 AM. kma
Misdemeanor and Criminal TR Scheduling Order, signed by SJN on 9/30/22. bph
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M.G..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:50 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: Christianson, Prosecuting attorney Karl E. Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court. Defendant Adam Darrell Powers in court. DE does qualify for PD. Court advises of charges. Waive reading. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets SETC with DA and PSC.
Settlement conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Settlement conference on November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
